ovdesc.p: The MF.EXECUTE.ORDERS application would be used to execute orders placed using MF.ORDER.
This is a workfile and needs to be run in the 'V'erify mode.
It is possible to select the specific orders to be executed. It is possible to restrict processing of orders to:
a. A particular order by specifying the Order ID in ORDER.ID field.
b. A particular fund by specifying the ID of the Fund in the FUND.ID field.
c. A particular customer or a participation account by specifying the Customer ID or the Participation Account ID in the CUSTOMER.ID field or the PARTICIPATION.ACC field.
d. All orders pertaining to customers of a specific Account Officer in ACCOUNT.OFFICER field
e. Orders with specific transaction type. A specific TRANS.TYPE or ALL.DEBIT or ALL.CREDIT could be specified here.
f. Orders with specific order type. MARKET or PRICE orders.
g. Orders placed between two dates.

Once the record is verified, all the orders matching the selection criteria specified above (if multiple conditions are specified, all conditions have to be met for the order to be selected) and with DEAL.STATUS set to EXECUTE would be processed. The trade details would be updated in the order. MF.TRADE records would be created with all the required details from the order. The status of the Trade (whether created in IHLD or INAU status) would be based on TRADE.STATUS field in the application.All relevant charges would be populated in the trades created in INAU status. The process for creation of trades would be performed by a T24 service running in the background.

desc.p: Free format narrative to be mapped onto trades.
1-35 alpha numeric characters.
ID of the MF.EXECUTE.ORDERS application.

Sixteen Digit ID – e.g. MFEXEC0500100001 (where MFEXEC would be constant, 05 stands for year, 001 stands for Julian date and 00001 stands for the sequence number. The ID would be automatically generated by the system on entry of F3.
ID of the participation account of the customer for whom orders have to be executed.
Valid SEC.ACC.MASTER ID
When orders placed between two dates have to be executed, this represents the end date of range.
Standard T24 Date format.

Specifies the type of the order to be executed. If MARKET is specified, all market orders would be executed at offer/bid price in SECURITY.MASTER. If PRICE is specified, all Price orders whose Price is within the price range specified (for subscriptions, if order price is greater than or equal to market price and for redemptions, order price is less than or equal to Market price) would be selected and executed.
Allowed values are 'PRICE' or 'MARKET'.
Specifies the transaction type of the orders that need to be executed.
Valid SC.TRANS.NAME ID or 'ALL.DEBIT' or 'ALL.CREDIT'. With 'ALL.CREDIT', all subscription orders would be executed and with 'ALL.DEBIT', redemption orders would be executed.
The ID of the Order to be executed.
Should be a valid MF.ORDER ID
This would be the trade date populated in the trades and would be the system date on which execution is processed.
Standard T24 Date format.
Represents the ID of the Account officer for whose customers the orders have to be executed.
Valid DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER ID
ID of the customer for whom orders have to be executed.
Valid CUSTOMER ID
When orders placed between two dates have to be executed, this represents the starting date of range.
Standard T24 Date format.
ID of the fund for which orders have to be executed.
Valid MF.FUND.MASTER ID
Specifies whether the trade to be created should be in ‘IHLD’ status or ‘INAU’ status.All the applicable charges would be populated in the trades created in INAU status.
Allowed values are 'HLD' or 'NAU'
